page.title: 02Health and Social Concerns
page.content: Egerton is served by 3 group practices, all about 5 miles away. For non_urgent visits to the doctor villagers must go by car; a service is organised locally for those without transport as buses do not run between these villages. In an emergency a doctor can reach the village very promptly and an ambulance in 15 mins. There is no community health clinic but health visitors, mid_wives and district nurses regularly visit from each practice. Neither chiropody nor dental services are available locally. Our medical services are adequate, but many feel a doctors' surgery could be held perhaps in conjunction with a child health clinic in the village on a regular basis. This would help the least mobile in the community viz. the elderly, infirm, and mothers with small children.
